Instruction: Gently pound the chicken breasts between sheets of wax paper to about 1/8 inch thickness, being careful not to tear the chicken. Wrap and refrigerate the chicken until the compound butter is firm.

Combine softened butter, 1/2 teaspoon each of pepper and garlic powder in a small bowl, mix thoroughly. Spread the seasoned butter into a 2x4 inch rectangle on a piece of aluminum foil, then freeze until firm.
Roll and enclose each seasoned butter piece in chicken breast, folding and securing edges with toothpicks.
Coat each chicken roll in the seasoned flour, egg mixture, and bread crumbs. Once coated, place the chicken in a dish, cover, and refrigerate for approximately 30 minutes.

Fry chicken rolls in the preheated skillet over medium-high heat for about 5 minutes on each side or until golden brown and cooked through. Remove and drain on paper towels. Garnish with lemon slices and parsley, then serve.
